text: Henry John Bagge (15 September 1896 – 27 April 1967) was an English professional football wing half who made over 170 appearances in the Football League for Fulham. He later managed Spanish clubs Athletic Bilbao and Salamanca. He was described as "a consistent player who feeds his forwards with discrimination". == Personal life == In December 1915, over a year since the beginning of the First World War, Bagge attested in the Royal Naval Air Service. He served as an Air Mechanic 2nd Class through the war and later in the Royal Air Force, before being transferred to the RAF Reserve in March 1919. == Career statistics == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" ! rowspan="2" |Club ! rowspan="2" |Season ! colspan="3" |League ! colspan="2" |FA Cup ! colspan="2" |Total |- !Division !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- | rowspan="7" |Fulham |1919–20 | rowspan="7" |Second Division |7 |0 |0 |0 |7 |0 |- |1920–21 |35 |0 |5 |0 |40 |0 |- |1921–22 |31 |0 |3 |0 |34 |0 |- |1922–23 |30 |0 |1 |0 |31 |0 |- |1923–24 |40 |1 |3 |0 |43 |1 |- |1924–25 |26 |0 |0 |0 |26 |0 |- |1925–26 |10 |0 |0 |0 |10 |0 |- ! colspan="3" |Career total !179 !1 !12 !0 !191 !1 |} ==References== ==External links== Category:1896 births Category:1967 deaths Category:English footballers Category:Fulham F.C. players Category:English football managers Category:English expatriate football managers Category:Athletic Bilbao managers Category:UD Salamanca managers Category:Footballers from Tottenham Category:Northfleet United F.C. players Category:Southern Football League players Category:Athletic Bilbao footballers Category:Royal Naval Air Service personnel Category:Royal Air Force personnel of World War I Category:Association football wing halves Category:English expatriate sportspeople in Spain Category:Segunda División managers Category:La Liga managers Category:Expatriate football managers in Spain
